verses.text: \w So|strong="H5921"\w* \w all|strong="H3605"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w was|strong="H3478"\w* \w recorded|strong="H3789"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w genealogies|strong="H3187"\w* \w written|strong="H3789"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Book|strong="H5612"\w* \w of|strong="H4428"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w Kings|strong="H4428"\w* \w of|strong="H4428"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*. \w But|strong="H2009"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w was|strong="H3478"\w* \w exiled|strong="H1540"\w* \w to|strong="H3478"\w* Babylon \w because|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H4428"\w* \w their|strong="H3605"\w* \w unfaithfulness|strong="H4604"\w*.

\w Now|strong="H3478"\w* \w the|strong="H3548"\w* \w first|strong="H7223"\w* \w to|strong="H3478"\w* \w resettle|strong="H3427"\w* \w their|strong="H3427"\w* \w own|strong="H3548"\w* property \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w their|strong="H3427"\w* \w cities|strong="H5892"\w* \w were|strong="H3478"\w* \w Israelites|strong="H3478"\w*, \w priests|strong="H3548"\w*, \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w*, \w and|strong="H3478"\w* \w temple|strong="H5411"\w* \w servants|strong="H5411"\w*.\f + \fr 9:2 \ft Hebrew Nethinim\f*

These \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w some|strong="H4480"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w Benjamin|strong="H1144"\w*, Ephraim, \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w Manasseh|strong="H4519"\w* \w who|strong="H1121"\w* \w lived|strong="H3427"\w* \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*:
Uthai son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, a descendant of Perez son of Judah.
From the Shilonites: Asaiah the firstborn and his sons.
From the Zerahites: Jeuel and 690 relatives.
From the Benjamites: Sallu son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
Ibneiah son of Jeroham; Elah son of Uzzi, the son of Michri; Meshullam son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
and 956 of their relatives according to their genealogy. All these men were heads of their families.
From the priests: Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, and Jachin;
Azariah son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the chief official of God’s temple;

Adaiah son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah; Maasai son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith,\f + \fr 9:12 \ft Meshillemith is a variant of Meshillemoth; see Nehemiah 11:13.\f* the son of Immer;
and 1,760 of their relatives, the heads of their families, able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
From the Levites: Shemaiah son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, a descendant of Merari;
Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;
Obadiah son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; and Berechiah son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
These were the gatekeepers: Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their relatives. Shallum was their chief;
he was previously stationed at the King’s Gate on the east side. These were the gatekeepers from the camp of the Levites.

Shallum son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph,\f + \fr 9:19 \ft Ebiasaph is a variant of Abiasaph; see Exodus 6:24.\f* the son of Korah, and his relatives from the Korahites were assigned to guard the thresholds of the Tent, just as their fathers had been assigned to guard the entrance to the dwelling of the LORD.
In earlier times Phinehas son of Eleazar had been in charge of the gatekeepers, and the LORD was with him.
Zechariah son of Meshelemiah was the gatekeeper at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
The number of those chosen to be gatekeepers at the thresholds was 212. They were registered by genealogy in their villages. David and Samuel the seer had appointed them to their positions of trust.

\w So|strong="H1992"\w* \w they|strong="H1992"\w* \w and|strong="H1121"\w* \w their|strong="H3068"\w* \w descendants|strong="H1121"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* assigned \w to|strong="H3068"\w* \w guard|strong="H4931"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w*—\w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* called \w the|strong="H5921"\w* Tent.

\w The|strong="H1961"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w* \w were|strong="H1961"\w* stationed \w on|strong="H1961"\w* \w the|strong="H1961"\w* four \w sides|strong="H7307"\w*: \w east|strong="H4217"\w*, \w west|strong="H3220"\w*, \w north|strong="H6828"\w*, \w and|strong="H3220"\w* \w south|strong="H5045"\w*.

\w Their|strong="H3117"\w* relatives came \w from|strong="H3117"\w* \w their|strong="H3117"\w* \w villages|strong="H2691"\w* \w at|strong="H3117"\w* fixed \w times|strong="H6256"\w* \w to|strong="H6256"\w* serve \w with|strong="H5973"\w* \w them|strong="H3117"\w* \w for|strong="H3117"\w* seven-day periods.

\w But|strong="H3588"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* four \w chief|strong="H1368"\w* \w gatekeepers|strong="H7778"\w*, \w who|strong="H1992"\w* \w were|strong="H1961"\w* \w Levites|strong="H3881"\w*, \w were|strong="H1961"\w* entrusted \w with|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w rooms|strong="H3957"\w* \w and|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* treasuries \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* God.

\w They|strong="H1992"\w* would \w spend|strong="H3885"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w night|strong="H3885"\w* stationed \w around|strong="H5439"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w of|strong="H1004"\w* God, \w because|strong="H3588"\w* \w they|strong="H1992"\w* \w were|strong="H1992"\w* responsible \w for|strong="H3588"\w* guarding \w it|strong="H5921"\w* \w and|strong="H1004"\w* \w opening|strong="H4669"\w* \w it|strong="H5921"\w* \w every|strong="H5439"\w* \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*.

\w Some|strong="H1992"\w* \w of|strong="H3627"\w* \w them|strong="H1992"\w* \w were|strong="H1992"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w charge|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H3627"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w articles|strong="H3627"\w* \w used|strong="H3627"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* worship, \w to|strong="H3318"\w* \w count|strong="H4557"\w* \w them|strong="H1992"\w* \w whenever|strong="H3588"\w* \w they|strong="H1992"\w* \w were|strong="H1992"\w* \w brought|strong="H3318"\w* \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w or|strong="H5656"\w* \w taken|strong="H3318"\w* \w out|strong="H3318"\w*.

\w Others|strong="H1992"\w* \w were|strong="H1992"\w* put \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w charge|strong="H5921"\w* \w of|strong="H3627"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w furnishings|strong="H3627"\w* \w and|strong="H8081"\w* \w other|strong="H3605"\w* \w articles|strong="H3627"\w* \w of|strong="H3627"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w sanctuary|strong="H6944"\w*, \w as|strong="H1992"\w* well \w as|strong="H1992"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* \w fine|strong="H5560"\w* \w flour|strong="H5560"\w*, \w wine|strong="H3196"\w*, \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*, \w frankincense|strong="H3828"\w*, \w and|strong="H8081"\w* \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*.

\w And|strong="H1121"\w* \w some|strong="H4480"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w priests|strong="H3548"\w* \w mixed|strong="H4842"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*.

\w A|strong="H3068"\w* \w Levite|strong="H3881"\w* \w named|strong="H5921"\w* \w Mattithiah|strong="H4993"\w*, \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w firstborn|strong="H1060"\w* \w son|strong="H1060"\w* \w of|strong="H4480"\w* \w Shallum|strong="H7967"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w Korahite|strong="H7145"\w*, \w was|strong="H1931"\w* entrusted \w with|strong="H5921"\w* baking \w the|strong="H5921"\w* bread.

\w Some|strong="H4480"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w their|strong="H5921"\w* \w Kohathite|strong="H6956"\w* \w brothers|strong="H1121"\w* \w were|strong="H1121"\w* \w responsible|strong="H4480"\w* \w for|strong="H5921"\w* preparing \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w rows|strong="H4635"\w* \w of|strong="H1121"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w showbread|strong="H3899"\w* \w every|strong="H7676"\w* \w Sabbath|strong="H7676"\w*.

\w Those|strong="H5921"\w* \w who|strong="H3881"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* \w musicians|strong="H7891"\w*, \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w heads|strong="H7218"\w* \w of|strong="H7218"\w* \w Levite|strong="H3881"\w* families, stayed \w in|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* temple \w chambers|strong="H3957"\w* \w and|strong="H7218"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* exempt \w from|strong="H5921"\w* other \w duties|strong="H4399"\w* \w because|strong="H3588"\w* \w they|strong="H3588"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* \w on|strong="H5921"\w* \w duty|strong="H5921"\w* \w day|strong="H3119"\w* \w and|strong="H7218"\w* \w night|strong="H3915"\w*.

\w All|strong="H3427"\w* \w these|strong="H3881"\w* \w were|strong="H3881"\w* \w heads|strong="H7218"\w* \w of|strong="H3427"\w* \w Levite|strong="H3881"\w* families, \w chiefs|strong="H7218"\w* according \w to|strong="H3389"\w* \w their|strong="H3427"\w* \w genealogies|strong="H8435"\w*, \w and|strong="H3389"\w* \w they|strong="H3389"\w* \w lived|strong="H3427"\w* \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*. The Descendants of Saul
Jeiel the father \f + \fr 9:35 \ft Or the founder\f* of Gibeon lived in Gibeon. His wife’s name was Maacah.
Abdon was his firstborn son, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
Mikloth was the father of Shimeam.\f + \fr 9:38 \ft Shimeam is a variant of Shimeah; see 1 Chronicles 8:32.\f* They too lived alongside their relatives in Jerusalem.
Ner was the father of Kish, Kish was the father of Saul, and Saul was the father of Jonathan, Malchishua, Abinadab, and Esh-baal.
The son of Jonathan: Merib-baal, who was the father of Micah.

The sons of Micah: Pithon, Melech, Tahrea, and Ahaz.\f + \fr 9:41 \ft Vulgate and Syriac (see also LXX and 1 Chronicles 8:35); Hebrew Pithon, Melech, and Tahrea; note that Tahrea is a variant of Tarea.\f*

Ahaz was the father of Jarah; Jarah \f + \fr 9:42 \ft Most Hebrew manuscripts; some Hebrew manuscripts and LXX Jadah; Jadah; note that Jarah and Jadah are variants of Jehoaddah; see 1 Chronicles 8:36.\f* was the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri was the father of Moza.
Moza was the father of Binea. Rephaiah \f + \fr 9:43 \ft Rephaiah is a variant of Raphah; see 1 Chronicles 8:37.\f* was his son, Elasah his son, and Azel his son.
And Azel had six sons, and these were their names: Azrikam, Bocheru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
